title.narrative: Small and Medium-Sized Enterprises Line of Credit Project

description.narrative: The proposed project is a line of credit to small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) in Sri Lanka with an innovative feature of allocating loan proceeds to participating financial institutions (PFIs) via an auction system. The project also includes an attached technical assistance (TA) for export-oriented cluster development to develop Sri Lanka's next generation of SMEs.

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President
Reports and Recommendations of the President

By 2018, at least 60% of women entrepreneurs trained under the project have applied for business loans or have business plans endorsed by a business development service provider (2015 baseline: 0) (OP 1.1, OP 1.2, OP 2.1.3, OP 2.3.1)
By 2019, at least one cluster-based loan is financed (2015 baseline: 0) (OP 1.2.2)

By 2023, $167.5 million lent via the credit line to SMEs that are (i) located outside Colombo district, (ii) borrowing for non-collateral working capital, (iii) led by women, or (iv) new borrowers (2015 baseline: 0) (OP 1.2.1, OP 1.3.3, OP 2.1.3)
By 2016, a report on a national credit guarantee scheme for SMEs endorsed by the steering committee (2015 baseline: not applicable) (OP 1.2.2, OP 6.1.2)
